folder.name: Unified Audit Assessment
folder.description: Analyse Audit data based on UNIFIED_AUDIT_TRAIL

folder.name: Audit Sessions
folder.tooltip: Information about Audit sessions with overview and drill-down
folder.description: Overview of the various audit sessions with drill-down to the individual events of a session. Reports are available for the various audit types, e.g. proxy session, standard, RMAN, DataPump and more.

display.name: by type Datapump
display.description: Displays audit sessions for audit type Datapump, similar in function to the script aud_sessions_datapump_show_aud.sql. With drill-down to session details.

query.sql: SELECT max(u.event_timestamp) "START_TIMESTAMP", u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.sessionid, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id, COUNT(u.entry_id) "RECORDS" FROM unified_audit_trail u WHERE u.dbid = con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) AND audit_type = 'Datapump' AND (:days IS NULL OR event_timestamp>=sysdate-:days) AND (:dbuser IS NULL OR dbusername = upper(:dbuser)) GROUP BY u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id ORDER BY "START_TIMESTAMP" DESC

display.name: Details
display.description: Available details for a particular datapump session

query.sql: SELECT event_timestamp, dbusername, entry_id, statement_id, action_name, return_code, dp_text_parameters1, dp_boolean_parameters1, audit_type, unified_audit_policies, sql_text FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE sessionid = :SESSIONID OR sessionid = :PROXY_SESSIONID ORDER BY event_timestamp ASC, entry_id ASC

display.name: by any type
display.description: Displays audit sessions for any audit type, similar in function to the script aud_sessions_show_aud.sql. With drill-down to session details.

query.sql: SELECT max(u.event_timestamp) "START_TIMESTAMP", u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id, COUNT(u.entry_id) "RECORDS" FROM unified_audit_trail u WHERE u.dbid = con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) AND (:days IS NULL OR event_timestamp>=sysdate-:days) AND (:dbuser IS NULL OR dbusername = upper(:dbuser)) GROUP BY u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id ORDER BY "START_TIMESTAMP" DESC

display.name: Details
display.description: Available details for a particular session

query.sql: SELECT event_timestamp, dbusername, entry_id, statement_id, action_name, return_code, object_schema, object_name, audit_type, unified_audit_policies, sql_text, system_privilege_used, current_user FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE sessionid = :SESSIONID OR sessionid = :PROXY_SESSIONID ORDER BY event_timestamp ASC, entry_id ASC

display.name: Proxy Sessions
display.description: Displays audit proxy sessions for audit type Standard based on UNIFIED_AUDIT_TRAIL. With drill-down to session details.

query.sql: SELECT max(u.event_timestamp) "START_TIMESTAMP", u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id, COUNT(u.entry_id) "RECORDS" FROM unified_audit_trail u WHERE u.dbid = con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) AND audit_type = 'Standard' AND u.proxy_sessionid <> 0 AND (:days IS NULL OR event_timestamp>=sysdate-:days) AND (:dbuser IS NULL OR dbusername = upper(:dbuser)) GROUP BY u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id ORDER BY "START_TIMESTAMP" DESC

display.name: Details
display.description: Available details for a particular session

query.sql: SELECT event_timestamp, dbusername, entry_id, statement_id, action_name, return_code, object_schema, object_name, audit_type, unified_audit_policies, sql_text, system_privilege_used, current_user FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE sessionid = :SESSIONID OR sessionid = :PROXY_SESSIONID ORDER BY event_timestamp ASC, entry_id ASC

display.name: Session Details
display.description: List detail of a particular session
display.tooltip: List detail of a particular session

query.sql: SELECT event_timestamp, dbusername, entry_id, statement_id, action_name, return_code, object_schema, object_name, unified_audit_policies, client_program_name, sql_text FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE sessionid = :SESSIONID OR sessionid = :PROXY_SESSIONID ORDER BY event_timestamp ASC, entry_id ASC

display.name: Session Overview
display.description: Show audit sessions for audit any type
display.tooltip: Show audit sessions for audit any type.

query.sql: SELECT max(u.event_timestamp) "START_TIMESTAMP", u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.terminal, u.client_program_name, u.instance_id, COUNT(u.entry_id) "Audit Entries" FROM unified_audit_trail u WHERE u.dbid = con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) AND audit_type = 'Standard' AND (:days IS NULL OR event_timestamp>=sysdate-:days) AND (:dbuser IS NULL OR dbusername = upper(:dbuser)) GROUP BY u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.terminal, u.client_program_name, u.instance_id ORDER BY "START_TIMESTAMP" DESC

SELECT event_timestamp, dbusername, entry_id, statement_id, action_name, return_code, object_schema, object_name, unified_audit_policies, sql_text FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE sessionid = :SESSIONID OR sessionid = :PROXY_SESSIONID ORDER BY event_timestamp ASC, entry_id ASC

display.name: by type DB Vault
display.description: Displays audit sessions for audit type Database Vault, similar in function to the script aud_sessions_dbv_show_aud.sql. With drill-down to session details.
display.tooltip: Sessions by audit type Database Vault

query.sql: SELECT max(u.event_timestamp) "START_TIMESTAMP", u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id, COUNT(u.entry_id) "RECORDS" FROM unified_audit_trail u WHERE u.dbid = con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) AND audit_type = 'Database Vault' AND (:days IS NULL OR event_timestamp>=sysdate-:days) AND (:dbuser IS NULL OR dbusername = upper(:dbuser)) GROUP BY u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id ORDER BY "START_TIMESTAMP" DESC

display.name: Details
display.description: Available details for a particular Database Vault session

query.sql: SELECT event_timestamp, dbusername, entry_id, statement_id, action_name, return_code, dv_action_code, dv_action_name, dv_extended_action_code, dv_grantee, dv_return_code, dv_action_object_name, dv_rule_set_name, dv_comment, dv_factor_context, dv_object_status, audit_type, unified_audit_policies, sql_text FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE sessionid = :SESSIONID OR sessionid = :PROXY_SESSIONID ORDER BY event_timestamp ASC, entry_id ASC

display.name: by type Direct path API
display.description: Displays audit sessions for audit type Direct path API based on UNIFIED_AUDIT_TRAIL. With drill-down to session details.
display.tooltip: Sessions by audit type Direct path API

query.sql: SELECT max(u.event_timestamp) "START_TIMESTAMP", u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.sessionid, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id, COUNT(u.entry_id) "RECORDS" FROM unified_audit_trail u WHERE u.dbid = con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) AND audit_type = 'Direct path API' AND (:days IS NULL OR event_timestamp>=sysdate-:days) AND (:dbuser IS NULL OR dbusername = upper(:dbuser)) GROUP BY u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id ORDER BY "START_TIMESTAMP" DESC

display.name: Details
display.description: Available details for a particular session

query.sql: SELECT event_timestamp, dbusername, entry_id, statement_id, action_name, return_code, object_schema, object_name, audit_type, direct_path_num_columns_loaded, unified_audit_policies, sql_text, system_privilege_used, current_user FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE sessionid = :SESSIONID OR sessionid = :PROXY_SESSIONID ORDER BY event_timestamp ASC, entry_id ASC

display.name: by type FGA
display.description: Displays audit sessions for audit type FGA, similar in function to the script aud_sessions_fga_show_aud.sql. With drill-down to session details

query.sql: SELECT max(u.event_timestamp) "START_TIMESTAMP", u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.sessionid, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id, COUNT(u.entry_id) "RECORDS" FROM unified_audit_trail u WHERE u.dbid = con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) AND audit_type = 'FineGrainedAudit' AND (:days IS NULL OR event_timestamp>=sysdate-:days) AND (:dbuser IS NULL OR dbusername = upper(:dbuser)) GROUP BY u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.sessionid, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id ORDER BY "START_TIMESTAMP" DESC

display.name: Details
display.description: Available details for a particular Fine Grained Audit session

query.sql: SELECT event_timestamp, dbusername, entry_id, statement_id, action_name, return_code, fga_policy_name, audit_type, unified_audit_policies, sql_text FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE sessionid = :SESSIONID OR sessionid = :PROXY_SESSIONID ORDER BY event_timestamp ASC, entry_id ASC

display.name: by type Protocol
display.description: Displays audit sessions for audit type Protocol. With drill-down to session details

query.sql: SELECT max(u.event_timestamp) "START_TIMESTAMP", u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.sessionid, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id, COUNT(u.entry_id) "RECORDS" FROM unified_audit_trail u WHERE u.dbid = con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) AND audit_type = 'Protocol' AND (:days IS NULL OR event_timestamp>=sysdate-:days) AND (:dbuser IS NULL OR dbusername = upper(:dbuser)) GROUP BY u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.sessionid, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id ORDER BY "START_TIMESTAMP" DESC

display.name: Details
display.description: Available details for a particular session

query.sql: SELECT event_timestamp, dbusername, entry_id, statement_id, action_name, return_code, object_schema, object_name, audit_type, protocol_session_id, protocol_return_code, protocol_action_name, protocol_userhost, protocol_message, unified_audit_policies, sql_text, system_privilege_used, current_user FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE sessionid = :SESSIONID OR sessionid = :PROXY_SESSIONID ORDER BY event_timestamp ASC, entry_id ASC

display.name: by type RMAN_AUDIT
display.description: Displays audit sessions for audit type RMAN_AUDIT, similar in function to the script aud_sessions_rman_show_aud.sql. With drill-down to session details.

query.sql: SELECT max(u.event_timestamp) "START_TIMESTAMP", u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id, COUNT(u.entry_id) "RECORDS" FROM unified_audit_trail u WHERE u.dbid = con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) AND audit_type = 'RMAN_AUDIT' AND (:days IS NULL OR event_timestamp>=sysdate-:days) AND (:dbuser IS NULL OR dbusername = upper(:dbuser)) GROUP BY u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id ORDER BY "START_TIMESTAMP" DESC

display.name: Details
display.description: Available details for a particular RMAN session

query.sql: SELECT event_timestamp, dbusername, entry_id, statement_id, action_name, return_code, rman_session_recid, rman_session_stamp, rman_operation, rman_object_type, rman_device_type, audit_type, unified_audit_policies, sql_text FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE sessionid = :SESSIONID OR sessionid = :PROXY_SESSIONID ORDER BY event_timestamp ASC, entry_id ASC

display.name: by type Standard
display.description: Displays audit sessions for audit type standard, similar in function to the script aud_sessions_std_show_aud.sql. With drill-down to session details.

query.sql: SELECT max(u.event_timestamp) "START_TIMESTAMP", u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id, COUNT(u.entry_id) "RECORDS" FROM unified_audit_trail u WHERE u.dbid = con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) AND audit_type = 'Standard' AND (:days IS NULL OR event_timestamp>=sysdate-:days) AND (:dbuser IS NULL OR dbusername = upper(:dbuser)) GROUP BY u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.audit_type, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id ORDER BY "START_TIMESTAMP" DESC

display.name: Details
display.description: Available details for a particular session

query.sql: SELECT event_timestamp, dbusername, entry_id, statement_id, action_name, return_code, object_schema, object_name, audit_type, unified_audit_policies, sql_text, system_privilege_used, current_user FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE sessionid = :SESSIONID OR sessionid = :PROXY_SESSIONID ORDER BY event_timestamp ASC, entry_id ASC

folder.name: Top Audit Events
folder.tooltip: Reports on the most important audit events for various criteria.
folder.description: Provide information about audit events, selected and organized according to various criteria. This information can help you identify audit events that occur more frequently than expected or generate more data than expected.

display.name: Top Events by Client
display.description: Displays a ranking of Client Program based on the frequency of their associated events in the unified audit trail, offering insights into the most audited databases. Comparable to the script aud_top_host_aud.sql.

query.sql: SELECT "USERHOST", "EVENTS" FROM ( SELECT nvl(userhost, 'n/a') userhost, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail GROUP BY userhost ORDER BY events DESC )

display.name: Top Events by polices
display.description: Displays a ranking of audit policies based on the number of associated events, highlighting the most frequently triggered policies in the unified audit trail. Similar in function to the script aud_top_policy_aud.sql.

query.sql: SELECT "UNIFIED_AUDIT_POLICIES", "EVENTS" FROM ( SELECT nvl(unified_audit_policies, 'n/a') unified_audit_policies, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail GROUP BY unified_audit_policies ORDER BY events DESC )
SELECT nvl(action_name, 'n/a') action_name, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE unified_audit_policies = :UNIFIED_AUDIT_POLICIES GROUP BY action_name ORDER BY events DESC
SELECT nvl(userhost, 'n/a') userhost, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE unified_audit_policies = :UNIFIED_AUDIT_POLICIES GROUP BY userhost ORDER BY events DESC
SELECT nvl(object_name, 'n/a') object_name, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE unified_audit_policies = :UNIFIED_AUDIT_POLICIES GROUP BY object_name ORDER BY events DESC
SELECT nvl(dbusername, 'n/a') dbusername, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE unified_audit_policies = :UNIFIED_AUDIT_POLICIES GROUP BY dbusername ORDER BY events DESC

display.name: Top Events by Audit Type
display.description: Displays a ranking of Audit Type based on the frequency of their associated events in the unified audit trail, offering insights into the most audited databases.

query.sql: SELECT "AUDIT_TYPE", "EVENTS" FROM ( SELECT nvl(audit_type, 'n/a') audit_type, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail GROUP BY audit_type ORDER BY events DESC )

display.name: Top Events by DBID
display.description: Displays a ranking of database IDs (DBIDs) based on the frequency of their associated events in the unified audit trail, offering insights into the most audited databases. Comparable to the script aud_top_dbid_aud.sql.

query.sql: SELECT "DBID", "EVENTS" FROM ( SELECT nvl(dbid, 0) dbid, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail GROUP BY dbid ORDER BY events DESC )

display.name: Top Events by OS User
display.description: Displays a ranking of OS User based on the number of associated events, highlighting the most frequently triggered policies in the unified audit trail. Comparable to the script aud_top_osuser_aud.sql.

query.sql: SELECT "OS_USERNAME", "EVENTS" FROM ( SELECT nvl(os_username, 'n/a') os_username, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail GROUP BY os_username ORDER BY events DESC )

display.name: Top Events by Client Program
display.description: Displays a ranking of Client Program based on the frequency of their associated events in the unified audit trail, offering insights into the most audited databases. Comparable to the script aud_top_clientprog_aud.sql.
display.tooltip: Top Audit Events by Client Program

query.sql: SELECT "CLIENT_PROGRAM_NAME", "EVENTS" FROM ( SELECT nvl(client_program_name, 'n/a') client_program_name, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail GROUP BY client_program_name ORDER BY events DESC )

display.name: Top Events by Action
display.description: Displays a ranking of Action based on the frequency of their associated events in the unified audit trail, offering insights into the most audited databases. Comparable to the script aud_top_action_aud.sql.

query.sql: SELECT "ACTION_NAME", "EVENTS" FROM ( SELECT nvl(action_name, 'n/a') action_name, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail GROUP BY action_name ORDER BY events DESC )

display.name: Top Events by SQL Text
display.description: Summarizes and ranks SQL statements from the unified audit trail by their event frequency, highlighting the most frequently executed queries.

query.sql: SELECT "EVENTS", "SQL_TEXT" FROM ( SELECT sql_text, COUNT(*) events FROM ( SELECT event_timestamp, to_char(dbms_lob.substr(sql_text, 4000)) sql_text FROM unified_audit_trail ) GROUP BY sql_text ORDER BY events DESC )

display.name: Top Events by Object Schema
display.description: Shows a ranking of Object Schemas by event frequency, emphasizing the policies most often triggered in the unified audit trail. Comparable to the script aud_top_owner_aud.sql.

query.sql: SELECT "OBJECT_SCHEMA", "EVENTS" FROM ( SELECT nvl(object_schema, 'n/a') object_schema, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail GROUP BY object_schema ORDER BY events DESC )

display.name: Top Events by Object Name
display.description: Displays a ranking of object names based on the frequency of associated events in the unified audit trail, offering insights into the most audited objects. Similar to the script aud_top_object_aud.sql.

query.sql: SELECT "OBJECT_NAME", "OBJECT_SCHEMA", "EVENTS" FROM ( SELECT nvl(object_name, 'n/a') object_name, nvl(object_schema, 'n/a') object_schema, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail GROUP BY object_name, object_schema ORDER BY events DESC )

display.name: Session Overview
display.description: Overview of sessions accessing this object

query.sql: SELECT event_timestamp, dbusername, sessionid, proxy_sessionid, entry_id, statement_id, action_name, return_code, object_schema, object_name, unified_audit_policies, sql_text FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE object_schema = :OBJECT_SCHEMA AND object_name = :OBJECT_NAME ORDER BY event_timestamp ASC, entry_id ASC

display.name: Top Events by Application Context
display.description: Displays a ranking of Application Context based on the frequency of their associated events in the unified audit trail, offering insights into the most audited databases.

query.sql: SELECT "APPLICATION_CONTEXTS", "EVENTS" FROM ( SELECT nvl(application_contexts, 'n/a') application_contexts, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail GROUP BY application_contexts ORDER BY events DESC )

display.name: Top Events by External User ID
display.description: Presents a ranking of External User IDs based on the frequency of their associated events in the unified audit trail, offering insights into the most audited external user identities.
display.tooltip: Top Events by External User ID

query.sql: SELECT "EXTERNAL_USERID", "EVENTS" FROM ( SELECT nvl(external_userid, 'n/a') external_userid, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail GROUP BY external_userid ORDER BY events DESC )

display.name: Top Events by Global User ID
display.description: Presents a ranking of Global User IDs by the frequency of their associated events in the unified audit trail, providing insights into the most audited user identities.
display.tooltip: Top Events by Global User ID

query.sql: SELECT "GLOBAL_USERID", "EVENTS" FROM ( SELECT nvl(global_userid, 'n/a') global_userid, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail GROUP BY global_userid ORDER BY events DESC )

display.name: Top Events by none Oracle Object Name
display.description: Show top unified audit events by Object Name without Oracle maintained schemas
display.tooltip: Top Events by none Oracle Object Name

query.sql: SELECT "OBJECT_NAME", "OBJECT_SCHEMA", "EVENTS" FROM ( SELECT nvl(object_name, 'n/a') object_name, nvl(object_schema, 'n/a') object_schema, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE object_schema NOT IN ( SELECT username FROM dba_users WHERE oracle_maintained = 'Y' ) GROUP BY object_name, object_schema ORDER BY events DESC )

display.name: Session Details
display.description: Session accessing this objects

query.sql: SELECT event_timestamp, dbusername, sessionid, proxy_sessionid, entry_id, statement_id, action_name, return_code, object_schema, object_name, unified_audit_policies, sql_text FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE object_schema = :OBJECT_SCHEMA AND object_name = :OBJECT_NAME ORDER BY event_timestamp ASC, entry_id ASC

display.name: Events by Users
display.description: List of Audit Events by Users

query.sql: SELECT dbusername, count(*) EVENTS FROM unified_audit_trail GROUP BY dbusername ORDER BY events DESC
SELECT unified_audit_policies, count(*) EVENTS FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbusername =:DBUSERNAME GROUP BY unified_audit_policies ORDER BY events DESC
SELECT action_name, count(*) EVENTS FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbusername =:DBUSERNAME GROUP BY action_name ORDER BY events DESC
SELECT userhost, os_username, count(*) EVENTS FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbusername =:DBUSERNAME GROUP BY userhost, os_username ORDER BY events DESC

folder.name: Generate Statements
folder.tooltip: Reports to generate Audit Policy Statements using DBMS_METADATA
folder.description: These are not really reports as such, but queries to generate the various statements for creating, deleting, enabling or disabling the audit policies. Corresponding authorization on DBMS_METADATA is required.

display.name: Disable all audit policies
display.description: Generates statements to disable all audit policies as currently configured in AUDIT_UNIFIED_ENABLED_POLICIES.
display.tooltip: Generates statements to disable all audit policies

query.sql: SELECT 'NOAUDIT POLICY ' || policy_name || ';' || CHR(10) FROM audit_unified_enabled_policies WHERE entity_name = 'ALL USERS' AND entity_type = 'USER' UNION ALL SELECT 'NOAUDIT POLICY ' || policy_name || ' BY USERS WITH GRANTED ROLES ' || entity_name || ';' || CHR(10) FROM audit_unified_enabled_policies WHERE entity_type = 'ROLE' UNION ALL SELECT 'NOAUDIT POLICY ' || policy_name || ' BY ' || entity_name || ';' || CHR(10) FROM audit_unified_enabled_policies WHERE entity_name <> 'ALL USERS' AND entity_type = 'USER'

display.name: Enable all audit policies
display.description: Generates statements to enable all audit policies as currently configured in AUDIT_UNIFIED_ENABLED_POLICIES.
display.tooltip: Generates statements to enable all audit policies

query.sql: SELECT 'AUDIT POLICY ' || policy_name || ';' || CHR(10) FROM audit_unified_enabled_policies WHERE entity_name = 'ALL USERS' AND entity_type = 'USER' UNION ALL SELECT 'AUDIT POLICY ' || policy_name || ' BY USERS WITH GRANTED ROLES ' || entity_name || ';' || CHR(10) FROM audit_unified_enabled_policies WHERE entity_type = 'ROLE' UNION ALL SELECT 'AUDIT POLICY ' || policy_name || ' BY ' || entity_name || ';' || CHR(10) FROM audit_unified_enabled_policies WHERE entity_name <> 'ALL USERS' AND entity_type = 'USER'

display.name: Drop all audit policies
display.description: Generates statements to remove all audit policies, excluding those maintained by Oracle.
display.tooltip: Generates statements to drop all audit policies

query.sql: SELECT 'DROP AUDIT POLICY ' || policy_name || ';' || CHR(10) FROM audit_unified_policies WHERE oracle_supplied = 'NO' GROUP BY policy_name

display.name: Create all audit policies
display.description: Generates statements to recreate all audit policies as currently configured in AUDIT_UNIFIED_ENABLED_POLICIES.
display.tooltip: Generates statements to recreate audit policies

query.sql: SELECT '-- ' || policy_name || CHR(10) || TRIM(TRAILING CHR(10) FROM TRIM(TRIM(CHR(10) FROM command))) || ';' || CHR(10) || CHR(10) FROM ( SELECT dbms_metadata.get_ddl('AUDIT_POLICY', policy_name) AS command, policy_name FROM audit_unified_policies WHERE oracle_supplied = 'NO' AND common = 'NO' GROUP BY policy_name UNION ALL SELECT to_clob('COMMENT ON ' || policy_name || ' IS ' || comments) AS command, policy_name FROM audit_unified_policy_comments )

folder.name: Audit Configuration
folder.description: Reports on audit configuration, memory usage, segments, audit policies, cleanup events, cleanup jobs and more.

display.name: Clean Up Events
display.description: Displays the audit cleanup event from DBA_AUDIT_MGMT_CLEAN_EVENTS
display.tooltip: Displays the audit cleanup event from DBA_AUDIT_MGMT_CLEAN_EVENTS

display.name: Clean Up Jobs
display.description: Displays the audit cleanup jobs from DBA_AUDIT_MGMT_CLEANUP_JOBS
display.tooltip: Displays the audit cleanup jobs from DBA_AUDIT_MGMT_CLEANUP_JOBS

display.name: Configuration
display.description: List current audit configuration parameter
display.tooltip: Displays the audit configuration from DBA_AUDIT_MGMT_CONFIG_PARAMS

display.name: Last Archive Timestamp
display.description: Displays the audit cleanup jobs from DBA_AUDIT_MGMT_LAST_ARCH_TS
display.tooltip: Displays the audit cleanup jobs from DBA_AUDIT_MGMT_LAST_ARCH_TS

query.sql: SELECT "AUDIT_TRAIL", "RAC_INSTANCE", "LAST_ARCHIVE_TS", "DATABASE_ID", "CONTAINER_GUID" FROM( select * from dba_audit_mgmt_last_arch_ts )

display.name: Unified Audit Policies
display.description: This report offers a comprehensive overview of unified audit policies, drawing data from the views AUDIT_UNIFIED_POLICIES and AUDIT_UNIFIED_ENABLED_POLICIES. It facilitates a deeper understanding of the configuration and current status of audit policies within the system, similar to the script aud_policies_show_aud.sql. The report includes extensive drill-down options, allowing for detailed analysis based on comments, actions, and statements such as AUDIT, NOAUDIT, CREATE, and DROP, as well as events and inactive policies.
display.tooltip: Overview of unified audit policies by utilizing the views AUDIT_UNIFIED_POLICIES and AUDIT_UNIFIED_ENABLED_POLICIES.

query.sql: SELECT nvl(u.policy_name, a.policy_name) AS policy_name, decode(a.policy_name, u.policy_name, 'YES', 'NO') AS active, a.enabled_option, a.entity_name, a.entity_type, a.success, a.failure, u.audit_condition, u.condition_eval_opt, u.common, u.inherited, u.audit_only_toplevel, u.oracle_supplied FROM audit_unified_policies u FULL JOIN audit_unified_enabled_policies a ON u.policy_name = a.policy_name GROUP BY u.policy_name, a.policy_name, a.enabled_option, a.entity_name, a.entity_type, a.success, a.failure, u.audit_condition, u.condition_eval_opt, u.common, u.inherited, u.audit_only_toplevel, u.oracle_supplied ORDER BY u.policy_name, active, a.enabled_option, a.entity_name

display.name: Comment
display.description: Display the description for a specific Unified Audit Policy if it is available in AUDIT_UNIFIED_POLICY_COMMENTS.

query.sql: SELECT nvl(min(comments), 'Not defined') "Comment" FROM audit_unified_policy_comments WHERE policy_name=:POLICY_NAME

display.name: Actions
display.description: Display details about a specific unified audit policy based on view AUDIT_UNIFIED_POLICIES.

query.sql: SELECT * FROM audit_unified_policies WHERE policy_name=:POLICY_NAME

display.name: NOAUDIT Statement
display.description: Create the NOAUDIT POLICY statements for this unified audit policy as it is defined in AUDIT_UNIFIED_ENABLED_POLICIES

query.sql: SELECT 'NOAUDIT POLICY ' || policy_name || ';' || CHR(10) FROM audit_unified_enabled_policies WHERE policy_name = :POLICY_NAME AND entity_name = 'ALL USERS' AND entity_type = 'USER' UNION ALL SELECT 'NOAUDIT POLICY ' || policy_name || ' BY USERS WITH GRANTED ROLES ' || entity_name || ';' || CHR(10) FROM audit_unified_enabled_policies WHERE policy_name = :POLICY_NAME AND entity_type = 'ROLE' UNION ALL SELECT 'NOAUDIT POLICY ' || policy_name || ' BY ' || entity_name || ';' || CHR(10) FROM audit_unified_enabled_policies WHERE policy_name = :POLICY_NAME AND entity_name <> 'ALL USERS' AND entity_type = 'USER'

display.name: AUDIT Statement
display.description: Create the AUDIT POLICY statements for this unified audit policy as it is defined in AUDIT_UNIFIED_ENABLED_POLICIES

query.sql: SELECT 'AUDIT POLICY ' || policy_name || ';' || CHR(10) FROM audit_unified_enabled_policies WHERE policy_name = :POLICY_NAME AND entity_name = 'ALL USERS' AND entity_type = 'USER' UNION ALL SELECT 'AUDIT POLICY ' || policy_name || ' BY USERS WITH GRANTED ROLES ' || entity_name || ';' || CHR(10) FROM audit_unified_enabled_policies WHERE policy_name = :POLICY_NAME AND entity_type = 'ROLE' UNION ALL SELECT 'AUDIT POLICY ' || policy_name || ' BY ' || entity_name || ';' || CHR(10) FROM audit_unified_enabled_policies WHERE policy_name = :POLICY_NAME AND entity_name <> 'ALL USERS' AND entity_type = 'USER'

display.name: CREATE Statement
display.description: Create the CREATE AUDIT POLICY statements for this unified audit policy as it is defined in AUDIT_UNIFIED_ENABLED_POLICIES

query.sql: SELECT "COMMAND" FROM ( SELECT dbms_metadata.get_ddl('AUDIT_POLICY', :POLICY_NAME)||';' AS command FROM dual )

display.name: DROP Statement
display.description: Create the DROP AUDIT POLICY statement for this unified audit policy

query.sql: SELECT 'DROP AUDIT POLICY ' || policy_name || ';' || CHR(10) FROM audit_unified_policies WHERE policy_name = :POLICY_NAME GROUP BY policy_name

display.name: Events
display.tooltip: List the audit events for a particular audit policy

query.sql: SELECT nvl(count(*),0) AS events FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE :POLICY_NAME IS NOT NULL AND unified_audit_policies LIKE '%' || :POLICY_NAME || '%'

display.name: Inactive Policies
display.description: Lists inactive policies that still generate audit data. This occurs when a policy is disabled but the session has not been restarted.
display.tooltip: Lists inactive policies which sill creates audit data

query.sql: SELECT policy_name FROM ( SELECT policy_name FROM ( SELECT regexp_substr(unified_audit_policies, '[^,]+', 1, level) AS policy_name FROM ( SELECT nvl(regexp_replace(unified_audit_policies, '[[:space:]]+', ''), 'n/a') unified_audit_policies FROM unified_audit_trail GROUP BY unified_audit_policies ) CONNECT BY regexp_substr(unified_audit_policies, '[^,]+', 1, level) IS NOT NULL ) GROUP BY policy_name ORDER BY policy_name ) WHERE policy_name NOT IN ( SELECT policy_name FROM audit_unified_enabled_policies GROUP BY policy_name ) AND policy_name <> 'n/a'

display.name: Storage Usage
display.description: This report provides comprehensive details about the usage and configuration of the audit store, focusing especially on the DB ID and the archiving timestamp. It enables you to assess whether audit data can be deleted based on its age or if it originates from a different database. Additionally, the report offers a drill-down feature to view partition information, storage details, and purge statements. Similar to aud_storage_usage_aud.sql, aud_storage_usage_mod_gen_aud.sql and aud_storage_purge_gen_aud.sql
display.tooltip: Information about the Audit storage usage and configuration.

query.sql: SELECT name, value FROM ( SELECT 1 AS id, 'Sum of audit records' AS name, to_char(COUNT(*)) AS value FROM unified_audit_trail UNION SELECT 2 AS id, 'Sum of audit records for current DBID (' || con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) || ')' AS name, to_char(COUNT(*)) AS value FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbid = con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) UNION SELECT 3 AS id, 'Oldest audit record for current DBID (' || con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) || ')' AS name, to_char(MIN(event_timestamp), 'DD.MM.YYYY HH24:MI:SS') AS value FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbid = con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) UNION SELECT 4 AS id, 'Newest audit record for current DBID (' || con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) || ')' AS name, to_char(MAX(event_timestamp), 'DD.MM.YYYY HH24:MI:SS') AS value FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbid = con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) UNION SELECT 5 AS id, 'Last archive timestamp for current DBID (' || con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) || ')' AS name, to_char(MAX(last_archive_ts), 'DD.MM.YYYY HH24:MI:SS') AS value FROM dba_audit_mgmt_last_arch_ts WHERE audit_trail = 'UNIFIED AUDIT TRAIL' UNION SELECT 6 AS id, 'Sum of audit records older than event timestamp for current DBID (' || con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) || ')' AS name, to_char(COUNT(u.event_timestamp)) AS value FROM unified_audit_trail u, dba_audit_mgmt_last_arch_ts t WHERE t.audit_trail = 'UNIFIED AUDIT TRAIL' AND u.event_timestamp < t.last_archive_ts UNION SELECT * FROM ( SELECT 7 AS id, 'Sum of audit records for foreign DBID' AS name, to_char(COUNT(*)) AS value FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbid <> con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) ) WHERE value > 0 UNION SELECT * FROM ( SELECT 8 AS id, 'Oldest audit record for foreign DBID' AS name, to_char(MIN(event_timestamp), 'DD.MM.YYYY HH24:MI:SS') AS value FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbid <> con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) ) WHERE value IS NOT NULL UNION SELECT * FROM ( SELECT 9 AS id, 'Newest audit record for foreign DBID' AS name, to_char(MAX(event_timestamp), 'DD.MM.YYYY HH24:MI:SS') AS value FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbid <> con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) ) WHERE value IS NOT NULL UNION SELECT 10 AS id, 'Tablespace in use' AS name, LISTAGG(DISTINCT tablespace_name, ', ') WITHIN GROUP( ORDER BY tablespace_name ) AS value FROM dba_segments WHERE segment_name = 'AUD$UNIFIED' UNION SELECT 11 AS id, 'Amount of audit trail data partitions' AS name, to_char(COUNT(partition_name)) AS value FROM dba_tab_partitions WHERE table_name = 'AUD$UNIFIED' UNION SELECT 12 AS id, 'Audit Trail data partition interval' AS name, INTERVAL AS value FROM dba_part_tables WHERE owner = 'AUDSYS' AND table_name = 'AUD$UNIFIED' UNION SELECT 13 AS id, 'Audit Trail data partition type' AS name, partitioning_type AS value FROM dba_part_tables WHERE owner = 'AUDSYS' AND table_name = 'AUD$UNIFIED' UNION SELECT 14 AS id, 'Sum of audit trail segments (data, lob, index)' AS name, to_char(sys.dbms_xplan.format_size(SUM(bytes))) AS value FROM dba_segments WHERE owner = 'AUDSYS' UNION SELECT 15 AS id, 'Sum of audit trail segments (data, lob, index) for tablespace ' || tablespace_name AS name, to_char(sys.dbms_xplan.format_size(SUM(bytes))) AS value FROM dba_segments WHERE owner = 'AUDSYS' GROUP BY tablespace_name UNION SELECT 16 AS id, 'Average audit record length (last analyzed ' || to_char(last_analyzed, 'DD.MM.YYYY HH24:MI:SS') || ')' AS name, to_char(avg_row_len) AS value FROM dba_tables WHERE owner = 'AUDSYS' )

display.name: Partitions
display.description: List all partition of the unified audit base tables
display.tooltip: List all partition of the unified audit base tables

query.sql: SELECT * FROM dba_segments ds WHERE owner = 'AUDSYS' ORDER BY segment_name

display.name: Storage Statements
display.description: Generate audit storage modification statements

query.sql: SELECT code FROM ( SELECT 1 AS id, '-- Purge audit trail using last archive timestamp current DBID (' || con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) || ')' || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual UNION SELECT 2 AS id, 'BEGIN' || CHR(10) || ' dbms_audit_mgmt.alter_partition_interval(' || CHR(10) || ' interval_number => 1,' || CHR(10) || ' interval_frequency => ''DAY'');' || CHR(10) || 'END;' || CHR(10) || '/' || CHR(10) || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual UNION SELECT 3 AS id, '-- Alter unified audit trail tablespace' || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual UNION SELECT 4 AS id, 'BEGIN' || CHR(10) || ' dbms_audit_mgmt.set_audit_trail_location(' || CHR(10) || ' audit_trail_type => dbms_audit_mgmt.audit_trail_unified,' || CHR(10) || ' audit_trail_location_value => ''AUDIT_DATA'');' || CHR(10) || 'END;' || CHR(10) || '/' || CHR(10) || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual UNION SELECT 5 AS id, '-- Load spillover OS audit files in a unified audit trail' || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual UNION SELECT 6 AS id, 'BEGIN' || CHR(10) || ' dbms_audit_mgmt.load_unified_audit_files();' || CHR(10) || 'END;' || CHR(10) || '/' || CHR(10) || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual )

SELECT code FROM ( SELECT 1 AS id, '-- Purge audit trail using last archive timestamp for current DBID (' || con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) || ')' || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual UNION SELECT 2 AS id, 'BEGIN' || CHR(10) || ' dbms_audit_mgmt.clean_audit_trail(' || CHR(10) || ' audit_trail_type => dbms_audit_mgmt.audit_trail_unified,' || CHR(10) || ' use_last_arch_timestamp => TRUE);' || CHR(10) || 'END;' || CHR(10) || '/' || CHR(10) || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual UNION SELECT 3 AS id, '-- Purge all audit trail for current DBID (' || con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) || ')' || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual UNION SELECT 4 AS id, 'BEGIN' || CHR(10) || ' dbms_audit_mgmt.clean_audit_trail(' || CHR(10) || ' audit_trail_type => dbms_audit_mgmt.audit_trail_unified,' || CHR(10) || ' use_last_arch_timestamp => FALSE);' || CHR(10) || 'END;' || CHR(10) || '/' || CHR(10) || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual UNION SELECT 5 AS id, '-- Purge all audit trail for foreign DBID' || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual UNION SELECT * FROM ( SELECT 6 AS id, 'BEGIN' || CHR(10) || ' dbms_audit_mgmt.clean_audit_trail(' || CHR(10) || ' audit_trail_type => dbms_audit_mgmt.audit_trail_unified,' || CHR(10) || ' use_last_arch_timestamp => FALSE,' || CHR(10) || ' database_id => ' || dbid || ');' || CHR(10) || 'END;' || CHR(10) || '/' || CHR(10) || CHR(10) AS code FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbid <> con_id_to_dbid(sys_context('USERENV', 'CON_ID')) GROUP BY dbid ) WHERE code IS NOT NULL UNION SELECT 10 AS id, '-- Set last archive timestamp' || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual UNION SELECT 11 AS id, 'BEGIN' || CHR(10) || ' dbms_audit_mgmt.set_last_archive_timestamp(' || CHR(10) || ' audit_trail_type => dbms_audit_mgmt.audit_trail_unified,' || CHR(10) || ' last_archive_time => to_timestamp(''' || to_char(sysdate - 1 / 12, 'DD.MM.YYYY HH24:MI:SS') || ''',''DD.MM.YYYY HH24:MI:SS''));' || CHR(10) || 'END;' || CHR(10) || '/' || CHR(10) || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual UNION SELECT 12 AS id, '-- Clear last archive timestamp' || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual UNION SELECT 13 AS id, 'BEGIN' || CHR(10) || ' dbms_audit_mgmt.clear_last_archive_timestamp(' || CHR(10) || ' audit_trail_type => dbms_audit_mgmt.audit_trail_unified);' || CHR(10) || 'END;' || CHR(10) || '/' || CHR(10) || CHR(10) AS code FROM dual )

folder.name: Miscellaneous
folder.tooltip: All types of audit reports that have not yet been categorized
folder.description: All types of audit reports that have not yet been categorized. Mainly things that are still under development.

display.name: Top Audit Events by none Oracle Object Name
display.description: Show top unified audit events by Object Name without Oracle maintained schemas
display.tooltip: Top Audit Events by none Oracle Object Name

query.sql: SELECT "OBJECT_NAME", "OBJECT_SCHEMA", "EVENTS" FROM ( SELECT nvl(object_name, 'n/a') object_name, nvl(object_schema, 'n/a') object_schema, COUNT(*) events FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE object_schema NOT IN ( SELECT username FROM dba_users WHERE oracle_maintained = 'Y' ) GROUP BY object_name, object_schema ORDER BY events DESC )

SELECT u.event_timestamp, u.dbusername dbusername, u.sessionid sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.terminal, u.instance_id, u.statement_id statement_id, u.unified_audit_policies FROM unified_audit_trail u, v$database d WHERE u.dbid = d.dbid AND audit_type = 'Datapump'
SELECT sql_text,DP_TEXT_PARAMETERS1,DP_BOOLEAN_PARAMETERS1 from unified_audit_trail WHERE dbusername=:DBUSERNAME AND sessionid=:SESSIONID AND statement_id = :STATEMENT_ID

SELECT to_char(min(u.event_timestamp),'DD.MM.YYYY HH24:MI:SS') "Initial Event", u.dbusername dbusername, u.sessionid sessionid, u.os_username "OS User", u.userhost "User Hosst", u.instance_id "Instance Number", COUNT(u.entry_id) "Audit Entries" FROM unified_audit_trail u, v$database d WHERE u.dbid = d.dbid AND audit_type = 'Standard' AND (:days IS NULL OR event_timestamp>=sysdate-:days) AND (:dbuser IS NULL OR dbusername = upper(:dbuser)) GROUP BY u.dbusername, u.sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.instance_id ORDER BY "Initial Event" DESC

SELECT to_char(event_timestamp, 'DD.MM.YYYY HH24:MI:SS') "Event Time", entry_id, statement_id, action_name, return_code, object_schema, object_name, sql_text FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbusername = :DBUSERNAME AND sessionid = :SESSIONID ORDER BY event_timestamp ASC, entry_id ASC

SELECT u.event_timestamp, u.dbusername dbusername, u.sessionid sessionid, u.proxy_sessionid, u.os_username, u.userhost, u.terminal, u.instance_id, u.statement_id statement_id, u.unified_audit_policies FROM unified_audit_trail u, v$database d WHERE u.dbid = d.dbid AND audit_type = 'RMAN_AUDIT'

SELECT sql_text, rman_session_recid, rman_session_stamp, rman_operation, rman_object_type, rman_device_type FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbusername = :dbusername AND sessionid = :sessionid AND statement_id = :statement_id

folder.name: Audit Charts
folder.tooltip: Audit Reports with charts and drill-down
folder.description: A series of audit reports with diagrams and drill-downs, e.g. audit events per day and hour. These reports are ideal for an initial visual overview of the audit events. However, the runtime of the queries depends heavily on the amount of audit data. In some cases, the reports can be limited to a few days.

display.name: Events by Day
display.description: Chart for the number of audit events per day with the option to drill down by audit events per hour.
display.tooltip: Number of Audit Events per Day

query.sql: SELECT NULL "Events", -- group to_char(TRUNC(event_timestamp),'DD.MM.YYYY') "Day", -- series COUNT(*) "Amount" -- value FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE :days IS NULL OR event_timestamp>=sysdate-:days GROUP BY TRUNC(event_timestamp) ORDER BY TRUNC(event_timestamp)

display.name: History
display.description: Information about the oldest/newest audit event

query.sql: SELECT to_char(min(event_timestamp_utc),'DD.MM.YYYY HH24:MI:SS') "Oldest", to_char(max(event_timestamp_utc),'DD.MM.YYYY HH24:MI:SS') "Newest", count(*) "Total" FROM unified_audit_trail

display.name: by hour
display.description: Chart for the number of audit events per hour
display.tooltip: Number of Audit Events per Hour

query.sql: SELECT NULL "Events", -- group to_char(TRUNC(event_timestamp, 'HH24'),'HH24:MI:SS') "Hour", -- series COUNT(*) "Amount" -- value FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE (:days IS NULL OR event_timestamp>=sysdate-:days) AND TRUNC(event_timestamp) = :Day GROUP BY TRUNC(event_timestamp, 'HH24') ORDER BY TRUNC(event_timestamp, 'HH24')

display.name: DB Info
display.description: Number of Audit Events per DBID

query.sql: SELECT d.name "DB Name", u.dbid "DB ID", i.instance_name "Instance Name", u.instance_id "Instance Number", COUNT(u.event_timestamp) "Events" FROM unified_audit_trail u, gv$instance i, v$database d WHERE u.dbid = d.dbid AND u.instance_id = i.instance_number GROUP BY u.dbid, d.name, i.instance_name, u.instance_id

display.name: Events by User
display.description: Chart for the number of audit events per database user with the option to drill down audit events by audit policy, action, user host and audit policy with actions.
display.tooltip: Chart for the number of audit events per database user

query.sql: SELECT NULL "Events", -- group dbusername, -- series COUNT(*) -- value FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE :days IS NULL OR event_timestamp>=sysdate-:days GROUP BY dbusername ORDER BY dbusername

display.name: Audit Policy
display.description: Audit events for User by Audit Policy

CustomValues.TITLE_TEXT: Audit Events for user by Audit Policy
CustomValues.TITLE: true

query.sql: SELECT --NULL "Events", -- group dbusername, unified_audit_policies, -- series count(*) EVENTS -- value FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbusername =:DBUSERNAME GROUP BY dbusername,unified_audit_policies ORDER BY events DESC

display.name: Action
display.description: Audit Events for User by Action

CustomValues.TITLE_TEXT: Audit Events for User by Action
CustomValues.TITLE: true

query.sql: SELECT --NULL "Events", -- group dbusername, action_name, -- series count(*) EVENTS -- value FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbusername =:DBUSERNAME GROUP BY dbusername,action_name ORDER BY events DESC

display.name: User Host
display.description: Audit Events for User by User Host

query.sql: SELECT dbusername, userhost, -- group os_username, -- series count(*) EVENTS -- value FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbusername =:DBUSERNAME GROUP BY dbusername, userhost,os_username ORDER BY events DESC

display.name: Audit Policy and Actions
display.description: Audit Events for User by Audit Policy

query.sql: SELECT dbusername,unified_audit_policies,action_name, count(*) EVENTS FROM unified_audit_trail WHERE dbusername =:DBUSERNAME GROUP BY dbusername,unified_audit_policies,action_name ORDER BY unified_audit_policies, events DESC
